Package colorguard

Class GameBoard

  • java.lang.Object
    • colorguard.GameBoard
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class GameBoard
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    GameBoard class represents the board the game is played on It stores the jails, flag zones, and powerups To update the board, several methods are available, mainly movePiece(Piece p)
    Author:
    amaytripathi
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      GameBoard​()
      Constructor for GameBoard Initializes board to a 20 by 21 board that is empty All the lists are declared to be an empty list

      • getObject

        public GameObject getObject​(int r,
                            int c)
        Gets the GameObject at given Location (r, c)
        Parameters:
        r - row of the location
        c - column of the location
        Returns:
        a GameObject if an object is at (r, c), null if location is out of bounds or there is no object at (r, c)

      • getPiece

        public Piece getPiece​(int r,
                      int c)
        Gets the Piece at given Location (r, c)
        Parameters:
        r - row of the location
        c - column of the location
        Returns:
        the Piece at (r, c), null if (r, c) is out of bounds or there is a non Piece at (r, c)

        Parameters:

        c - column of the location
        Returns:
        true if in bounds, false if out of bounds

      • isSameSide

        public boolean isSameSide​(java.lang.String side,
                          Location loc)
        Checks if the given Location loc is on a side
        Parameters:
        side - "Red" or "Blue" to indicate the side to check
        loc - Location to check
        Returns:
        true if loc is on side, false otherwise

      • movePiece

        public void movePiece​(Piece p,
                      Location loc)

        Parameters:

        loc - new Location of the Piece

        p2 - other Piece to be swapped
